intro: Campanula napuligera f. scheuzeriformis, commonly known as the Scheuzeriform Campanula, is a rare and striking cultivar of the bellflower genus. It is characterized by its large, showy blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is a compact shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30–40 centimeters. This cultivar is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and its unique floral form.
